entries.title: Megan Thee Stallion: US jury finds Tory Lanez guilty of shooting hip-hop star
entries.description: The Canadian rapper faces more than 20 years in jail for wounding the Grammy-winning hip-hop star in 2020.

entries.title: In pictures: Scotland's amazing Christmas trees
entries.description: From royal palaces to glamorous restaurants to trees that aren't really trees.

entries.title: Notorious past of one of Scotland's most expensive streets
entries.description: Danube Street in Edinburgh was once home to Scotland's most famous brothel.

entries.title: Kalvin Phillips: Pep Guardiola says Man City midfielder was 'overweight' after World Cup
entries.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says Kalvin Phillips was "overweight" when he returned to training from the World Cup.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak thanks public servants with surprise Christmas calls
entries.description: Rishi Sunak phones diplomats, Royal Navy crew and other workers to thank them for their efforts.

entries.title: Train strikes: Passengers brace for Christmas Eve disruption
entries.description: Trains will stop running at around 15:00 on Saturday, as walkouts on the railways and other industries continue.

entries.title: Premiership Rugby: London Irish 29-20 Saracens
entries.description: London Irish survive a spell with just 12 men to hand Saracens their first Premiership defeat of the campaign.

entries.title: King's Christmas message to pay tribute to Queen's legacy
entries.description: Charles is set to include a tribute to his late mother in his first Christmas Day address.

entries.title: Ross County 0-1 Rangers: Michael Beale retains 100% start thanks to John Lundstram winner
entries.description: Rangers narrow the gap to Celtic to six points with a slender Scottish Premiership win over Ross County - a third in a row under Michael Beale.

entries.title: Boiling water turns to snow in freezing US state
entries.description: Even boiling water is freezing as dangerously cold temperatures sweep large parts of the US.

entries.title: The Sun apologises over Jeremy Clarkson's Meghan column
entries.description: The newspaper says it regrets publishing the piece, in which Clarkson said he "hated" the duchess.

entries.title: Santa-filled armoured truck gets stuck in Cornwall lane
entries.description: The Santas, who were thought to be on a pub crawl, got wedged in a hedge in Cornwall.

entries.title: Emiliano Martinez celebrations: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery to speak to goalkeeper
entries.description: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery plans to speak to goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez about his celebrations following Argentina's World Cup win.

entries.title: Scientists find secret to how glass frogs turn transparent
entries.description: Scientists discover the glass frog's "superpower" in its ability to pool blood to turn see-through.

entries.title: LadBaby: Food Aid is the UK's Christmas number one
entries.description: The charity campaigners now have more Christmas number ones than any other act in chart history.

entries.title: Premier League returns: Every Angle of Pajtim Kasami's 'exceptional' 2013 goal for Fulham
entries.description: To celebrate the Premier League's return, here is one of the competition's greatest goals, by Fulham's Pajtim Kasami's, from 2013.

entries.title: Manchester United: Where's Lisandro Martinez? Still celebrating in Argentina, says boss ten Hag
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag says Lisandro Martinez is still celebrating Argentina's World Cup win but reminds him that "he has to accept" that the Premier League resumes soon.

entries.title: Food bank delivers Christmas spirit in Oxfordshire with 'Big Lunch'
entries.description: A community group welcomes 150 people to a festive meal in Oxfordshire to fight loneliness and isolation.

entries.title: Woman dies in Oldham after being hit by police car
entries.description: The woman was hit by a police car which had been in pursuit of a suspected stolen vehicle, officers say.

entries.title: World Snooker Tour: Chen Zifan becomes eighth Chinese player to be suspended
entries.description: Chen Zifan is the eighth Chinese player to be suspended from the World Snooker Tour.

entries.title: Lakeside Miller & Carter floating restaurant starts to sink
entries.description: A Miller & Carter restaurant begins sinking into a lake at a major UK shopping centre.

entries.title: £20 daily bonus for troops covering Christmas strikes
entries.description: About 1,300 members of the armed forces are covering for ambulance and border staff walkouts.

entries.title: Zara Aleena: Family members 'completely destroyed' by murder
entries.description: Zara Aleena's aunt says the family is struggling with daily life six months on from her murder.

entries.title: Manchester City v Liverpool: Investigation after girl, 15, injured
entries.description: Greater Manchester Police are appealing for information after a number of incidents at Etihad Stadium.

entries.title: Donations for late Queen given to fuel bill charity
entries.description: Money donated in memory of Queen Elizabeth is being used to help those unable to pay energy bills.

entries.title: Kyra King: Mother admits losing control of dog that killed baby
entries.description: Kyra King was attacked in woodland in Lincolnshire as her parents walked 19 dogs.

entries.title: Ana de Armas fans told they can sue over Yesterday trailer
entries.description: Two fans complained after the actress was cut from a film despite featuring in the trailer.

entries.title: Euro 2022: The inside story of England's win, as told by the Lionesses
entries.description: In a new BBC film, Lionesses: Champions of Europe, members of the England team tell the inside story of Euro 2022.

entries.title: Mariupol theatre demolished 'to hide Russian crimes', aide says
entries.description: An aide to the Ukrainian city's exiled mayor says Russia is trying to cover up its crimes.

entries.title: How Watford got all its homeless people off the streets
entries.description: Homelessness in England is on the rise, but one scheme to stop rough sleeping has proved a success.

entries.title: George Cohen dies: Fulham great and 'England's greatest right-back'
entries.description: George Cohen will forever be immortalised as one of just 11 men to start and win a football World Cup final with England.

entries.title: Two dead after shooting in central Paris
entries.description: Gunman opens fire in central Paris, killing two people and injuring several others

entries.title: Flu and Covid: People told to stay home for Christmas if unwell
entries.description: Health officials warn people with flu or Covid symptoms to avoid mixing with vulnerable relatives.

entries.title: Further nurse strike dates announced in England
entries.description: NHS nurses to strike again on 18 and 19 January in England unless pay talks are opened, Royal College of Nursing says

entries.title: England World Cup winner George Cohen dies, aged 83
entries.description: England World Cup winner George Cohen dies, aged 83, his former club Fulham announces.

entries.title: Indian Premier League: England's Sam Curran becomes most expensive IPL player
entries.description: England's Sam Curran becomes the most expensive auction buy in the history of the Indian Premier League after being bought by Punjab Kings for £1.85m.

entries.title: The Traitors: Wilfred and Kieran are rooted out in BBC One finale
entries.description: Viewers were gripped to Thursday's final as a "parting gift" changed the course of the reality show.

entries.title: Forceps left in patient following Alexandra Hospital operation
entries.description: An investigation is launched at the Redditch hospital after the so-called never event.

entries.title: New Zealand v England: Stuart Broad returns to squad for two-match Test series
entries.description: Stuart Broad is recalled to the England squad for the two-Test series in New Zealand in February.

entries.title: Killamarsh murders: Deputy PM orders probation service review
entries.description: Damien Bendall killed his pregnant partner and three children while serving a suspended sentence.

entries.title: Manchester City 3-2 Liverpool: Kevin De Bruyne at his best when grumpy - Pep Guardiola
entries.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola believes Kevin De Bruyne plays at his best when "grumpy" as the midfielder starred in their 3-2 Carabao Cup win over Liverpool following a disappointing World Cup campaign.

entries.title: Serial killer The Serpent, Charles Sobhraj, freed from Nepal jail
entries.description: Charles Sobhraj, convicted for killing two tourists in 1975, was suspected of several murders in Asia.

entries.title: The Traitors: Watch who took home the prize money
entries.description: Spoiler alert: In the finale, Claudia Winkleman reveals who took home the jackpot of £120,000.

entries.title: Antarctic post office: A home for Christmas among the penguins
entries.description: Four British women are preparing to spend Christmas in the world's most southerly post office.

entries.title: Woman to turn garden into Christmas Eve food bank
entries.description: Sharon Valler will be offering free surplus supermarket food to people on Saturday evening.

entries.title: Brendan Loughnane: Professional Fighters League champion's story of 'perseverance and success'
entries.description: Manchester's Brendan Loughnane talks BBC Sport through the ups and downs of his journey towards becoming a world champion in the Professional Fighters League - and millionaire.

entries.title: Suicide: 'You're not alone, we all experience dark thoughts'
entries.description: A man who set up a mental health charity after his daughter took her own life urges people to talk.

entries.title: England Lionesses surprise woman with terminal cancer
entries.description: The 23-year-old, who has terminal cancer, says meeting her heroes was "one of the best days of my life."

entries.title: Baby born on helicopter between Isles of Scilly and Cornwall
entries.description: Baby Ebbyn was born in the rescue helicopter between the Isles of Scilly and Cornwall.

entries.title: Scotland gender reforms: UK ministers may block law
entries.description: A new law will simplify transitioning but UK ministers say they have concerns and may step in.

entries.title: Here are the key findings in the January 6 committee's final report
entries.description: The panel, which has recommended Donald Trump face criminal charges, releases its 845-page findings.

entries.title: Russia may send empty Soyuz to bring ISS crew home
entries.description: The crew members may have to return to Earth early after their capsule started leaking.

entries.title: Four tips for better recycling at Christmas
entries.description: How you can celebrate while doing less harm to the planet

entries.title: Vietnam veteran wins lottery six times on intuition
entries.description: The Massachusetts man's head-scratching strategy nets him nearly $2m, plus 20 annual payments of $25,000.

entries.title: Anxious Christmas for families of Indians held in Nigeria
entries.description: Families of 16 Indian sailors who have been detained in Africa since August say they are waiting anxiously.

entries.title: South Sudan floods: Fleeing Nile waters to a minefield
entries.description: Photos of people displaced by war bearing the brunt of a climate crisis along South Sudan's River Nile.

entries.title: West Indies bowled out for 43 as England complete 5-0 T20 series win
entries.description: England bowl out the West Indies for just 43 on their way to completing a 5-0 clean sweep in the T20 series in Barbados.

entries.title: Quiz of the Year, part one: Are you a 2022 news expert?
entries.description: How well do you remember the news of the past 12 months?

entries.title: Airport strikes: Border Force staff begin Christmas walkout
entries.description: Travellers arriving in the UK are warned to expect disruption and delays as staff who check passports go on strike.

entries.title: After an epic journey ends, what happens next?
entries.description: Migrants allowed into the US don't stay at the border long - this is how they decide where to go now.
